content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Easy and fun
Very interesting in shortest or fastest mode, test cases cover well all the constraints (none, sorted list, unique elements)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I accept to contribute since I believe this is a very practical algorithm exercise.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: A well though through and structured clash!
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!
Funny, description is clear to me

Goal section
* Please fix the following typos:
   • found => find
   • link to it => links to it (2 times)
   • nodes. You => nodes, you
   • Node are => A node is

* Please format "none" as a {{constant}} and remove the quotation marks.

Output section
* Please change "sorting" to "sorted".

* Please format "none" as a {{constant}} and remove the quotation marks.

Constraints section
* Why is the upper limit of n set as 676? 100 seems to be a better indication of the range of n.

Stub generator
* Suggest to change line 2 to "loop n read x:word(1) y:word(1)".

* Please add a write statement (e.g. "write answer" or "write root nodes").

Thanks.

Corrections are done.

I take your suggestions into consideration and I change the read loop. Also I rename variable to [[parent]], [[child]] to improve understanding.

676 is the number of combinaison possible without duplicate, including node links to itself (A A), and links in both side (A B, B A). But I decrease this value to 100 representing better the size of test cases.

Thanks a lot for your comment.
